etymology.interpretation: Rice suggests grains or texture, pointing to something unrefined or granular, while 且 supplies the historical sound that developed into cū. Together they evoke a grainy, rough quality in materials or appearance.

examples.chinese: 这块布很粗糙(這塊布很粗糙)。
examples.english: This piece of cloth is very coarse.

examples.chinese: 他把盐磨得太粗(他把鹽磨得太粗)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ yán mó de tài cū.
examples.english: He ground the salt too coarse.

examples.chinese: 这种砂纸太粗(這種砂紙太粗)。
